item.title: Tree stump, 24th November
item.description:
Early this year you decided to cut down the tree without any reason for being cut down any notification to residence you cut a tree down you left the stump in the ground. It’s actually quite dangerous and it is now being obscure by where the tree young new branches are growing from the stump that would’ve been nice if you’ve cut it down to remove it fill the whole tarmac and make it good and look neat and tidy because at the moment it is a bit of a trip hazard and it’s quite dangerous you leaving a tree stump without it being removed properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Street, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Floor carpeted with litter and glass outside primary school, 24th November
item.description:
The gutters, pavements and roads outside st Patrick’s primary school, Ancona road, are literally covered in litter. There are broken glass bottles of alcohol, empty beer cans and general litter all over the street and this has been slowly gathering for weeks despite it being reported. Please can a team come out to deal with this? The bulk of the glass is right outside the nursery where 3 and 4 year olds run around the school gates, it’s not safe.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Griffin Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp 2 not working, 24th November
item.description:
The lamp on the corner of West Street and Chandler Drive lamp number two the responsibility of Bexley Council is no longer working. The lightbulb has gone and it is very dark on that corner and because of the way the paving slabs are uneven which is again under the Bexley Council it could be a trip hazard and a legal lawsuit against the council for negligence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chandlers Drive, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Recycling Bin, 24th November
item.description:
Hi, I am hoping you are able to forward this to someone who can deal with this request. On Sunday 2nd November I noticed a recycling bin left near a request bus stop in Frances Street just up the road from Belson Road. By the afternoon of Tuesday 4th November the recycling bin had been walked passed by a few hundred people taking their children to Cardwell school. Late afternoon I had a walk passed the bin and noticed it is marked “23”. I had a walk round and could not find a home address of 23. When I got home I had a look on Google Maps in Street View. I found a local address for 23 in Lord Warwick Street. I waited until early evening when the occupant of number 23 had arrived home. I went out and rang their door bell. When the person opened the door I asked if they were missing a recycling bin but they said no. (I have added a copy of number 23 from Google Maps Street View below.) Image0.png I went out later Tuesday evening and when I returned home it looked like the recycling bin had been taken away. Then when I went out Thursday evening I noticed the recycling bin has only been moved to next to the bus shelter in Frances Street near the Belson Road junction. Could you please arrange for this recycling bin to be removed and reused by someone else who may need it. Thank you. Mr D Martin.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Frances Street, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 24th November
item.description:
There is a lot of rubbish all along the road, where the cars park in The Crescent. Also in the road beside the pavement (gutterj. There is also rubbish along the side of the pavement, There is also so much rubbish in the hedge. This is visible rubbish. Bottles, cans, paper, plastic, bags, a round weight (?). If possible could you send out more than one person, as there is a lot of rubbish. Also, along Church Avenue. There is part of a wooden fence there, looking very messy. You have the previous report of rubbish here listed as “fixed” but it is not fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
